od and General 
Nutrition) was implemented in two provinces of Madagascar, Antananarivo and Toliary, 
starting in 1993. Nongovernmental organizations (NGOs) were contracted to provide 
services to beneficiaries and supervision for community nutrition workers (CNWs) in target 
areas. CNWs provided services at community nutrition centers and were paid in rice by 
SECALINE for working on the project five days each week. The ratio of beneficiaries to 
nutrition workers was approximately 400 to 1200
